articles.title: Uzbek President on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Uzbek President on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The relations between the two countries are developing in various fields and Uzbekistan will make positive efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK.
 Uzbek President Islam Abduganiyevich Karimov said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to Uzbekistan Ri Tong Phal on Nov.1. 
 The leadership of the DPRK makes big efforts for the well-being of the people, he said, and pointed out:    
 We highly appreciate the consistent principle of the leadership of Korea headed by leader Kim Jong Il.    
 We welcome and will support the efforts of the Korean people to defend the sovereignty and ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
 We hold that the Koreans should solve the internal affairs of the nation by themselves without interference of foreign forces.

Protocols between DPRK and Cuba Inked
articles.content:
Protocols between DPRK and Cuba Inked 
    Havana, November 4 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 24th meeting of the Intergovernmental Committee for Economic, Scientific and Technical Consultation between the DPRK and Cuba and a protocol on exchange of commodity for 2006 were signed in Havana on Nov. 4.
 The protocols were inked by Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade who is heading the government economic delegation of the DPRK, and Ricardo Cabrisas Ruiz, minister of the government of Cuba.

Visits
    Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Electricity and Coal Industries Sin Yong Song who is managing director of the Council of the Korea-China Hydroelectric Power Company left here today to participate in its 57th meeting to be held in China. 
 On the same day a delegation of the Russian Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Aleksandr Alekseyev, a delegation of the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China headed by Deputy Director Yu Yunyao and President of the Prensa Latina News Agency of Cuba Frank Gonzalez Garcia and his party arrived here.

Congratulations to Polish Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Polish Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Kazimiez Marcinkiewicz upon his appointment as prime minister of Poland.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations between the two countries will favorably develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the prime minister success in his responsible work.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Stefan Meller upon his appointment as foreign minister of Poland.
